TopicTitle: You guys make this look easy :/

Articles.Content: What do ya think? A little more planning and I suppose I can make it to the moon eventually!
kerbal wise, id say that mission went quite well.

That was a really funny episode man! I don't mean that offensively either. To get to the moon? Liquids are you elixir of life. Liquid engines that is! Using just stock, one stage of solids and liquids, and another stage of just liquids should get you into orbit. Your last stage should coast to the mun, and be a powed lander. Break a leg Then you can do a rescue mission

That was a really funny episode man! I don't mean that offensively either. To get to the moon? Liquids are you elixir of life. Liquid engines that is! Using just stock, one stage of solids and liquids, and another stage of just liquids should get you into orbit. Your last stage should coast to the mun, and be a powed lander. Break a leg Then you can do a rescue mission

SRBs are fine too. if you keep the liquid engines at max throttle all the way out of the atmosphere, you might as well replace some with SRBs. They have a much higher thrust:weight ratio (especially the smaller yellow ones), which is vital for a good ship. Only problem is they don't burn for as long, and are slightly more prone to exploding. Just think about it: once they add some sort of campaign to the game, SRBs will be non-reusable, and therefore more costly. yet, they will still be useful enough to keep them ingame. theyre just that awesome.

also, why not use stock parts? the mods that ive tried seem to make the game far too easy, especially since there's no cost to parts yet.
